SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
DatagramTimeClient
The DatagramTimeClient class represents a client for retrieving time information using UDP Datagram sockets.
DatagramTimeClient
The DatagramTimeClient class implements a client that sends periodic requests to a server to get the current time.
DatagramTimeServer
The DatagramTimeServer class implements a server that listens on a specified port, receives UDP datagram requests from clients, and responds with the current date and time.
EchoClient
The EchoClient class represents a client for communicating with an Echo server over a TCP connection.
EchoClient
The EchoClient class represents a client for communicating with an Echo server over a TCP connection.
EchoClientRMI
The EchoClientRMI class represents a client for invoking remote methods using RMI (Remote Method Invocation).
EchoServer
The EchoServer class represents a server that echoes messages received from clients over a TCP connection.
EchoServer
The EchoServer class implements a simple HTTP server that listens on port 35000, accepts client connections, and serves requested files from a specified webroot directory.
EchoServerFunc
The EchoServerFunc class implements a server that listens on a specified port, accepts client connections, and performs mathematical operations based on client input.
EchoServerImpl
The EchoServerImpl class implements the EchoServerRMI interface and provides functionality for an RMI (Remote Method Invocation) echo server.
EchoServerRMI
The EchoServerRMI interface defines the methods that can be invoked remotely by clients in an RMI (Remote Method Invocation) echo server.
EchoServerSquare
The EchoServerSquare class implements a simple server that listens on a specified port, accepts client connections, reads input from the client, calculates the square of the input number, and sends the result back to the client.
Exercise_1
The Exercise_1 class demonstrates how to parse and extract components from a URL string.
Exercise_2
The Exercise_2 class allows the user to input a URL from the console, retrieves the content from the URL, and saves it to a file named "resultado.html".
HttpServer
The HttpServer class represents a simple HTTP server that responds with a basic HTML page to client requests.
